review.title: A Rational and Efficient Algorithm for View Revision in Databases
review.abstract: The dynamics of belief and knowledge is one of the major components of any autonomous system that should be able to incorporate new pieces of information. In this paper, we argue that to apply rationality result of belief dynamics theory to various practical problems, it should be generalized in two respects: first of all, it should allow a certain part of belief to be declared as immutable; and second, the belief state need not be deductively closed. Such a generalization of belief dynamics, referred to as base dynamics, is presented, along with the concept of a generalized revision algorithm for Horn knowledge bases. We show that Horn knowledge base dynamics has interesting connection with kernel change and abduction. Finally, we also show that both variants are rational in the sense that they satisfy certain rationality postulates stemming from philosophical works on belief dynamics.

sections.text: Chandrabose [7,8], defines a contraction operator in terms of deletion in terms of a set of formulas or sentences that Hansson uses [21] to bring about a change in the knowledge base. Similar to our approach, it focuses on formulas or sentences in the knowledge base to update them. Insertion and deletion of formulas are considered on the same level.
